requiredMoves.description: When you enter into a dangerous situation, roll +Duty. On a 10+, hold 2. On 7-9, hold 1. On a miss, the danger has the drop on you.
holds: You were well-prepared for this mission and have access to a useful piece of equipment or upgrade.
You take evasive maneuvers. The first harm to your team or the ship is 1 less.
You were ready to fight. On the first Open Fire, on a hit, give it one extra hold.

optionalMoves.description: When you roll a hit with Go Boldly, take Advantage Forward to your next roll.

When attempting to get the ship out of a dangerous situation, roll +Duty. On a 10+, you’re gone. On a 7-9, you can go or stay, but it’ll cost you (ship damage, system offline, leave something behind, take something with you).
When directing a ship in combat, use +Rank instead of +War to Open Fire.
When leading an away team, the first member of the crew to roll Go Boldly can use your Duty instead of their own.

When on an away mission, roll +Rank. On a 10+, one of the inhabitants becomes infatuated with you. On a 7-9, someone with history with you is entangled with the away mission but might also prove useful. On a miss, a past entanglement causes complications.

descriptors.name: Career
descriptors.advancement: If you were forced out of your comfort zone for the sake of the mission, mark experience.

descriptors.name: Spiritual
descriptors.advancement: If your faith or beliefs were challenged by the mission, mark experience.

descriptors.name: Logical
descriptors.advancement: If you leveraged someone else’s emotions in order to succeed, mark experience.

descriptors.name: Hotshot
descriptors.advancement: If you refused to play it safe against another’s orders, mark experience.

quote:
"Captain, as your exec, it's my duty to point out alternatives."
	-Will Decker to James T. Kirk, 2270s
	(Star Trek: The Motion Picture)
roleFluff:
Aboard a starship the first officer was the second-in-command, just below the captain. On a Federation starship, the first officer had the following functions:
	-[Serving] as the principal adviser to the captain
	-Implementing the captain's orders
	-Preparing and issuing duty rosters.... (VOY: "The Gift", "Tsunkatse", "Endgame")
	-Managing the ship's resources, including systems allocation (TNG: "Lessons")
	-Commanding the vessel in the event of the captain's absence, incapacitation or death (VOY: "Night", "Before and After"; TNG: "The Battle", "The Best of Both Worlds", "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II", "Tapestry", "Gambit, Part I")
	-Working with the chief medical officer or counselor on crew evaluations (TNG: "Man of the People", "Lower Decks")
	-Attending important meetings and briefings with the captain (Star Trek Into Darkness)
			-Memory Alpha Wiki
